Once you’ve taken off around a third of its health, Fuban will back up and burrow back into the ground. Once again, it will start to swim through the sand at you, which your lock on will thankfully stick to.
img_below_text:
This time, Fuban will swim right under you, and pierce upward with its horn to try and skewer you. The good news is that by using your Pillar Stance, you can raise up away from the explosion, and will only lose a chunk of stamina as the sand erupts, while avoiding damage.

1. **Summary of the Image**:  
The image depicts an intense moment in the battle against Fuban, a sand-dwelling enemy in *Black Myth: Wukong*. The protagonist, Wukong, is seen leaping into the air as Fuban bursts through the sand with its horn, causing an explosion of debris and sand around them.

2. **Purpose, Content, or Narrative Role**:  
The image illustrates a key phase of the fight where Fuban attacks by emerging from beneath the sand to skewer the player. It highlights the need for the player to use evasive maneuvers, such as the Pillar Stance, to avoid taking damage from the erupting sand and debris. This visual serves to emphasize the dynamic and strategic nature of the encounter.
